reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 10 days and when i arrived at this hotel it was like i entered heaven, it was lovely. The hotel has 3 swimming pools, a beach of its own and a golf course.
reviews.title: Eye Opener Hotel with Great views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The decoration in the hotel is lovely. It is like a dream.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: However, if travelling to Cairo please ensure that you can speak or understand some arabic as the staff at the hotel do not understand english properly. You have to repeat yourself a couple of times. At times you feel like hitting your head in a brick wall when people in and around Cairo do not understand English.
reviews.title: Impressed

reviews.text: Lovely hotel; has it all business or leisure sure to find ur way....enjoyed the pools and beach (artificial) the spa is so good.....room service and food are up to highest standards.....executive lounge perfect in all aspects.....had an executive suit; spacious with 2 lovely balconies looking at the golf course, all amenities are there, comfortable bed.....its a lovely escape from crowded Cairo....finally staff are friendly and professional.
reviews.title: Great Hotel. Great golf course. Great Food options at the hotel.

reviews.text: After staying some days in another supposed 5 star hotel in Port Said and with a mid class service, comming here was HEAVEN. The hotel its really nice. Front desk crew excellent treatment besided when we booked a car ( BMW750) with some company that was next to the front desk the treatment was terrbile, they didnt care about tourism and they told us that in the face, besides they increased us the price when we decided to take it. somebody should do something about this. Anyway, great restaurants you can choose whatever you like and the conference room were pretty ok.My room was perfect, clean and with view to the golf yard,Room service was fast. dont forget to TIP its always good to increase service. Overall excellent hotel, just 15 minutes from the airport but far away from the city center. So if its only to hold conferences or business meetings and no planning to go to walk around the city , i fully recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Awesome comfort & Luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Although the hotel is pretty far from the city, there is a hotel van that runs daily to the market, museum and such. Our van driver Gamal was great.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.text: I stayed here a couple of times in February. On each occasion I found the experience a little overwhelming. The hotel is huge and labrynthine and decorated in a rather over the top way - Napoleon meets Harrods. Having said that the staff are outstanding - polite and welcoming in the Egyptian way. The rooms are comfortable with good broadband access. Good laundry service and the beds are comfortable. There is a wide choice of restaurants and the ones I tried were good (Italian and Steak bar). If you want something more middle eastern there is a Lebanese restaurant which looked good but I was with colleagues and clients so ended up where I did. The leisure facilities are outstanding - pools, massages, gyms etc. Great bar staff too. If you are going into Cairo for Pyramid trips etc. be prepared for a drive as the hotel is located in "New Cairo". Overall, a good hotel with excellent staff - the scale of it and the decor may put off some.
reviews.title: An eye opening hotel

reviews.text: I recently returned from a 4 night stay at the JW Marriott and have nothing but great memories. We had a junior executive suite which was beautiful and was replenished with fresh fruit and flowers daily and cleaned 2 times a day. The service and choice of food in the executive lounge was outstanding. The pool/fitness room/steam room/jacuzzi were top notch. The hotel is beautifully appointed and is very welcoming and warm, not stuffy and unapproachable like some other 5-star hotel chains. The free shuttles into the city were on time and reliable. We will definitely be staying at the JW Marriott during our next family trip to Cairo.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel with great service

reviews.text: I enjoyed staying here very much... the room was well-appointed, the bed was very comfortable, with lovely soft sheets; nice modern bathroom. Service was excellent. Italian restaurant was very good; breakfast also very good. Gym and pools were great. Spa is lovely. Great choice if you need to be in this part of Cairo. Probably the best choice for that area.
reviews.title: Very comfortable and pleasant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: HOTEL - Ours was a 10 day long holiday. I was accompanying my husband on his business so used to hv the whole day to myself. I loved exploring the hotel every day and discovering each corner of the hotel. Its huge, well kept and clean.
reviews.title: Lovely property,more than a 5 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived at the Cairo airport, the hotel driver was waiting with our name on a sign to pick us up. Within ten minutes we were at the hotel. The rooms are nice and the pool area is massive; waterslides and pools great for everyone. The club room had snacks in the evenings and an excellent breakfast spread in the morning; including an omelet station. We mentioned it was our anniversary and they decorated the room with rose petals and gave us a cake made with fresh fruit that was delicious.
reviews.title: Wondereful hotel with an awesome club room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The negative thing about this hotel is definitely the concierge. They are overpriced and rude. Take the shuttle to the mall and take the taxi back for much less than the hotel charges. We took a day tour organized by the concierge and we felt ripped off. The driver was rude and took us to the places he got kick backs from. If you take a tour from them, be sure to be assertive on where you want to go and stand your ground.
reviews.title: Convenient luxury to Cairo Airport

reviews.text: Downtown Cairo is a mad house and it was nice to come back to the JW Marriot to relax. Also shopping is better and much cheaper in Luxor rather than in Cairo's markets. The hotel is located far from the city center and sites but it was good as we felt very safe there.
reviews.title: One of the nicest Hotels I have stayed at in the world

reviews.text: Overall we loved this hotel and would recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Magnificent and cosy five star hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here on the last night of our 8 day visit to Egypt, arriving at 5 pm and leaving the next morning at 7:30 am. We did eat at the hotel's very good Lebanese restaurants. Its swimming pool is enormous and fantastic, it reminded me of the Belaggio in Las Vegas without the crowds. Mixed business and tourists at the hotel. Very nice sized and comfortable rooms, efficient. Close to Cairo Airport, not close to pyramids or other tourist sites. Good for a fly in and out. I would not make it the focal point of a holiday as you would spend too much time in traffic going places. It was perfect for what we needed on our final evening.
reviews.title: Peace in Cairo

reviews.text: Sprawling hotel, with large pools and expansive grounds in a gated city outside Cairo. The hotel is on a highway and there's pretty much nothing around it in terms of recreation or sight-seeing. Rooms are large with a decent balcony, and beds and bathroom very comfortable. Lots of good food outlets, not too expensive. The Italian and the Mediterranean restaurants were very good. Internet pretty expensive though, with wired internet in-room and wifi only in the public areas.
reviews.title: Solid Business Hotel away from town

reviews.text: Maintenance of the grounds and public areas seemed a bit iffy, but adequate, and the hotel probably doesn't deserve the 'JW Marriott' branding. But it seemed to be the only good hotel in this upcoming business area.
reviews.title: Away from the hustle and bustle of Cairo
Nice Staff - Very Large Resort
reviews.text: There is little local flavor to the hotel or the area around it, and you wouldn't know if you were in Cairo or anywhere else in the world.
Overall, a good hotel, nothing very special but serves the purpose well if you need to be in this area.
reviews.title: Nirvana hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: if you wanna get away from busy Cairo then this is the hotel for you, overall positive experience, service is good, staff are friendly, food variety is excellent.
reviews.title: Check your bill before signing the payment
